frameDefinitions: A Communicator communicates a judgment of an Evaluee to an Addressee.
The  Speaker expresses through language his wish to get the Addressee to act in some way that will help to bring about events or states described in the Content.
An Agent intends and takes steps towards bringing about a State_of_affairs or, metonymically, towards acquiring a Sought_entity .
In this frame, a Communicator judges the Addressee and then communicates that appraisal directly to the Addressee.
frameExamples: I <t>commended</t> his handling of the crisis.
Mr Smithers always <t>encourages</t> the employees to stay late and work harder.
The principal <t>rebuked</t> the student for cheating on the exam.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Communicator</fen> uses language in the written or spoken modality to convey his or her evaluation of the <fen>Evaluee</fen> to another person.
<fen>Medium</fen> identifies the physical or abstract setting in which the evaluation is conveyed.
<fen>Topic</fen> identifies the entity to which the proposition or propositions conveyed relate.
A judgment is made about the <fen>Evaluee</fen>  With verbs this role is typically expressed as Object:
<fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part that conveys the judgment made by the <fen>Communicator</fen>.
Typically, there is a constituent expressing the <t>Reason</t> for the <fen>Communicator</fen>'s judgment. It is usually a <ment>for</ment>-PP.
When the communication of the judgment takes place.
Where the communication of the judgment takes place.
The wish for action on the Addressee's part that the Speaker expresses.
The person that the <fen>Speaker</fen> seeks to influence to act.
The person who intends through the use of language to get another person to act.
What the communication is about.
The written or spoken material that contains a message that potentially influences the <fen>Addressee</fen> towards the <fen>Content</fen>.
An entity which the <fen>Speaker</fen> believes should participate in the action.
The time at which the lobbying occurs.
The location where the <fen>Speaker</fen> attemtps susaion on an <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> makes an attempt to achieve a <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> or to  obtain a <fen>Sought_entity</fen>.
The entity that the <fen>Agent</fen> attempts to acquire.
A state or event that the <fen>Agent</fen> wants to bring about. The Agent may but need not be a participant in that <fen>State_of_affairs</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the attempt occurs.
The place where the <fen>Agent</fen> is seeking to achieve a particular <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> or to acquire a <fen>Sought_entity</fen>.
The <fen>Communicator</fen> communicates a judgment to the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The <fen>Addressee</fen> is jduged by the <fen>Communicator</fen> and receives the message of approval or disapproval.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject on which the <fen>Addressee</fen> is being judged.
The <fen>Reason</fen> is why the Communicator forms the type of judgment they form.
The <fen>Medium</fen> identifies the physical or abstract entity in which the judgment is conveyed.
An action or entity under the control of the <fen>Communicator</fen> that expresses the criticism or praise directed towards the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The point in time at which the <fen>Communicator</fen> berates or compliments the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Communicator</fen> admonishes the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
listRoleExamples: Jon criticized Madie <fex>about her managerial style</fex>.
She viewed him with a critical <fex>gaze</fex>.
He was belittled by his long-time friend <fex>in front of his family</fex>.

<fex>Those states</fex> sought a remedy that would substantially change the company's business
practices.
Or the monstrous Saddam, who filled mass graves to bursting, invaded two neighboring countries, and avidly sought <fex>weapons of mass destruction</fex>.
The disclosure came as prosecutors successfully sought <fex>in federal court</fex> to keep Luise Garofalo behind bars.
The teacher scolded the children <fex>about their meessy cookie eating</fex>.
The principal rebuked the student <fex>for cheating on the exam</fex>.
Though she had killed him so long ago, she could still see his jeering <fex>smile</fex>.
She complimented me <fex>almost every morning</fex> on my smart starched shirts.
We were scolded <fex>in the kitchen</fex> by the biggest cook you've ever seen.

passageCandidateSpans.text: The Motion Picture Association of America
